meanings.definition: A collection of written texts, especially the entire works of a particular author or a body of writing on a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The library holds various corpuses of Shakespeare's plays.
meanings.sent2: Researchers analyzed different corpuses of ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent3: The corpuses of fairy tales in the library seemed to whisper to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast corpus of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The corpuses of historical documents painted a vivid picture of the past.

meanings.definition: A collection of written or spoken material, especially on a computer.
meanings.sent1: The hard drive contained multiple corpuses of research papers.
meanings.sent2: The internet is a vast corpus of information accessible to all.
meanings.sent3: The corpuses of data on his laptop seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her inbox was a corpus of unread emails waiting for attention.
meanings.sent5: The corpuses of digital archives made finding information quick and easy.
